dogecoin.text: @Pennyroyal_Oil @Flytin21 @Newegg @dogecoin I went thru a difficult time with all this many years ago. I realize now that this subject is psychic leverage on the masses. I would just say, please check it out more, you can find your home as a green advocate in this space and benefit the world. Check out Cardano in Africa

@Pennyroyal_Oil @Flytin21 @Newegg @dogecoin I think there is a lot of fear being tossed about in the mainstream. If you check it out a bit more I think you will see a strong effort toward environmental responsibility in this space.

@Pennyroyal_Oil @Flytin21 @Newegg @dogecoin I feel we're moving in the right direction. Bitcoin is a relic, it was the window in which we saw thru to better systems. Now, we are working with technologies such as Hedera, for instance which consume less energy than Visa. There are carbon offsets attached to crypto now.

@Pennyroyal_Oil @Flytin21 @Newegg @dogecoin All the systems in place and factory assets in place to produce, exchange and transport fiat is so vast I doubt there are figures which we can look at to really analyze the whole thing.
@Pennyroyal_Oil @Flytin21 @Newegg @dogecoin The infrastructure surrounding paper fiat is staggering. The people, the machines, the vehicles, the planes, the on and on and on all for paper money.

@Pennyroyal_Oil @Flytin21 @Newegg @dogecoin I think what we need is a supercomputer to start crunching analytics to find answers for fears such as yours. Doing more of the same is certainly not the answer. As the population increases, damage thru paper cash causes so much harm I can't even begin - it's tragic.

@Pennyroyal_Oil @Flytin21 @Newegg @dogecoin As adoption occurs and payments are made with cards attached to crypto and spent like a visa, less people will be inclined to even handle fiat. It's progress which is necessary. Staying stuck in the past via fear of change is not useful imho.
